decomposedCriteria.originalText: Participant must be ≥ 18 years of age
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is a single, straightforward demographic requirement. It is represented as a single atomic node with a numeric constraint.

expression.strategy: This is a standard demographic requirement to ensure the participant is legally an adult for consent and safety reasons.

provenance.textSnippet:
6.2.1
Inclusion Criteria
Patients that meet the following eligibility criteria will be included:
• Participant must be ≥ 18 years of age

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Written informed consent and written documentation, in accordance with the relevant country and local privacy requirements, had been obtained prior to any study procedures
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion consists of two related documentation requirements ('Written informed consent' AND 'written documentation') that must both be completed before a specific time point ('prior to any study procedures'). This is modeled as an AND operator for the two documentation types, which is then wrapped in a temporal BEFORE operator.

operands.atomicText: Written informed consent obtained in accordance with relevant country and local privacy requirements
operands.strategy: Confirms patient has formally agreed to participate in the study according to regulatory standards. This is a procedural check.

operands.atomicText: Written documentation obtained in accordance with relevant country and local privacy requirements
operands.strategy: Confirms all necessary privacy and study-related documentation is complete as per local regulations. This is a procedural check.

provenance.textSnippet:
• Participant must be ≥ 18 years of age
•
Written informed consent and written documentation, in accordance with the
relevant country and local privacy requirements, had been obtained prior to
any study procedures

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Had used artificial tears for dry eyes within the past year
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: This criterion is a single condition with a temporal constraint. It is decomposed into a temporal node that specifies 'within the past year', which in turn wraps a single atomic node representing the use of artificial tears for dry eyes.

operand.atomicText: Used artificial tears for dry eyes
operand.strategy: Query for drug exposure records for 'artificial tears' and link them to a 'dry eyes' condition to confirm the indication.

provenance.textSnippet:
relevant country and local privacy requirements, had been obtained prior to
any study procedures
•
Had used artificial tears for dry eyes within the past year

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Females of childbearing potential, with a negative pregnancy test result at Screening; these patients must have been currently using a reliable form of birth control and have agreed to use a reliable form of birth control for the duration of the study
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is structured as a conditional requirement, best represented by an IMPLICATION operator. The condition is being a 'Female of childbearing potential'. If this condition is met, a set of three requirements, connected by AND, must also be met: a negative pregnancy test, current use of reliable birth control, and agreement to continue its use.

condition.strategy: Identifies the specific sub-population to which the pregnancy and contraception requirements apply.

operands.atomicText: Positive pregnancy test result at Screening
operands.strategy: A negative test result is required. This is modeled as the absence of a positive test result.

operands.atomicText: Currently using a reliable form of birth control
operands.strategy: Confirms the patient is using an acceptable contraceptive method at the time of screening.

operands.atomicText: Agreed to use a reliable form of birth control for the duration of the study
operands.strategy: Documents the patient's commitment to maintain contraception throughout the study, typically captured in the informed consent form.

provenance.textSnippet:
•
Had used artificial tears for dry eyes within the past year
• Females of childbearing potential, with a negative pregnancy test result at
Screening; these patients must have been currently using a reliable form of
birth control and have agreed to use a reliable form of birth control for the
duration of the study

decomposedCriteria.originalText: OSDI score of ≥ 18 and ≤ 65 (based upon a 0 to 100 scale) at Screening and Baseline Visits
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion specifies a required range for the OSDI score that must be met at two distinct time points: Screening and Baseline. This is a conjunction, modeled with a root AND operator, connecting two separate atomic conditions, one for each visit.

operands.atomicText: OSDI score of ≥ 18 and ≤ 65 at Screening Visit
operands.strategy: Measures the Ocular Surface Disease Index (OSDI) score at the Screening visit to confirm patient has moderate to severe disease symptoms.

operands.atomicText: OSDI score of ≥ 18 and ≤ 65 at Baseline Visit
operands.strategy: Confirms the Ocular Surface Disease Index (OSDI) score remains within the eligible range at the Baseline visit prior to randomization or treatment.

provenance.textSnippet:
birth control and have agreed to use a reliable form of birth control for the
duration of the study
•
OSDI score of ≥ 18 and ≤ 65 (based upon a 0 to 100 scale) at Screening and
Baseline Visits

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Three consecutive tear break-up time (TBUT) tests ≤ 10 seconds in at least 1 eye at Screening Visit
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is decomposed by first applying the overarching temporal context 'at Screening Visit' using a temporal node. The core requirement 'in at least 1 eye' is then modeled as an OR operator with two operands, one for the left eye and one for the right. The complex condition 'Three consecutive ... tests ≤ 10 seconds' is treated as a single atomic unit within each operand.

operands.atomicText: Three consecutive tear break-up time (TBUT) tests ≤ 10 seconds in the left eye
operands.strategy: Requires identifying a series of three consecutive TBUT measurements for the left eye, where each measurement value is less than or equal to 10 seconds. This may require manual review or a complex query with window functions.

operands.atomicText: Three consecutive tear break-up time (TBUT) tests ≤ 10 seconds in the right eye
operands.strategy: Requires identifying a series of three consecutive TBUT measurements for the right eye, where each measurement value is less than or equal to 10 seconds. This may require manual review or a complex query with window functions.

provenance.textSnippet:
OSDI score of ≥ 18 and ≤ 65 (based upon a 0 to 100 scale) at Screening and
Baseline Visits
• Three consecutive tear break-up time (TBUT) tests ≤ 10 seconds in at least
1 eye at Screening Visit

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Grade 1 to 4 (modified National Eye Institute [NEI] Grid, score range = 0 to 5) staining in at least 1 area of the cornea (5 areas examined) or conjunctiva (6 areas examined) that was related to dry eye in at least 1 eye at both at Screening and Baseline Visits
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is structured as a conjunction (AND) over two time points: Screening and Baseline. At each time point, the requirement is a disjunction (OR) between staining found in the cornea or the conjunctiva. This leads to a top-level AND operator, with two OR operator children, each representing a visit.

operands.atomicText: Grade 1 to 4 corneal staining (modified NEI Grid) related to dry eye in at least 1 eye at Screening Visit
operands.strategy: This is a key inclusion criterion based on a specific ocular surface staining assessment performed at the Screening visit, indicating a sufficient level of dry eye disease in the cornea.

operands.atomicText: Grade 1 to 4 conjunctival staining (modified NEI Grid) related to dry eye in at least 1 eye at Screening Visit
operands.strategy: This is a key inclusion criterion based on a specific ocular surface staining assessment performed at the Screening visit, indicating a sufficient level of dry eye disease in the conjunctiva.

operands.atomicText: Grade 1 to 4 corneal staining (modified NEI Grid) related to dry eye in at least 1 eye at Baseline Visit
operands.strategy: This confirms the persistence of the ocular surface staining from Screening to the Baseline visit, ensuring the condition is stable and present at the start of the study.

operands.atomicText: Grade 1 to 4 conjunctival staining (modified NEI Grid) related to dry eye in at least 1 eye at Baseline Visit
operands.strategy: This confirms the persistence of the ocular surface staining from Screening to the Baseline visit, ensuring the condition is stable and present at the start of the study.

provenance.textSnippet:
1 eye at Screening Visit
• Grade 1 to 4 (modified National Eye Institute [NEI] Grid, score range = 0 to 5)
staining in at least 1 area of the cornea (5 areas examined) or conjunctiva
(6 areas examined) that was related to dry eye in at least 1 eye at both at
Screening and Baseline Visits

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Was able/agreed to continue to wear existing current spectacle correction during the study period (if applicable)
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is a conditional requirement, identified by the phrase '(if applicable)'. This is modeled using an IMPLICATION operator. The condition is that the subject uses spectacle correction, and the requirement is their agreement to continue wearing them during the study.

condition.strategy: Identifies subjects for whom wearing spectacles is applicable.

requirement.atomicText: Able and agreed to continue to wear existing current spectacle correction during the study period
requirement.strategy: Confirms subject compliance with maintaining consistent visual correction for study assessments.

provenance.textSnippet:
(6 areas examined) that was related to dry eye in at least 1 eye at both at
Screening and Baseline Visits
• Was able/agreed to continue to wear existing current spectacle correction
during the study period (if applicable)

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Currently corrected distance visual acuity of at least 20/32 Snellen equivalent in each eye using the 3-meter LogMar chart, with existing spectacle correction (if necessary) at Screening Visit
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion requires a specific visual acuity threshold to be met in 'each eye'. This phrasing implies a logical AND, where the condition must be true for the right eye AND true for the left eye. Therefore, the tree will have a root AND operator with two atomic operands, one for each eye.

operands.atomicText: Corrected distance visual acuity of at least 20/32 Snellen equivalent in the right eye at Screening Visit

numericConstraintStructured.parameter: Corrected distance visual acuity, right eye

operands.strategy: Ensures adequate visual function in the right eye. The test is performed using a 3-meter LogMar chart. A Snellen score of 20/32 is equivalent to a LogMAR score of 0.2, and 'at least' this acuity means a LogMAR score of 0.2 or lower (better vision).

operands.atomicText: Corrected distance visual acuity of at least 20/32 Snellen equivalent in the left eye at Screening Visit

numericConstraintStructured.parameter: Corrected distance visual acuity, left eye

operands.strategy: Ensures adequate visual function in the left eye. The test is performed using a 3-meter LogMar chart. A Snellen score of 20/32 is equivalent to a LogMAR score of 0.2, and 'at least' this acuity means a LogMAR score of 0.2 or lower (better vision).

provenance.textSnippet:
during the study period (if applicable)
• Currently corrected distance visual acuity of at least 20/32 Snellen equivalent
in each eye using the 3-meter LogMar chart, with existing spectacle correction
(if necessary) at Screening Visit

decomposedCriteria.originalText: If using any form of topical ophthalmic cyclosporine (i.e., RESTASIS®), lifitegrast 5% ophthalmic solution (Xiidra®), participants must be using the drops for ≥ 90 days prior to the Screening Visit and plan to continue without change for the duration of the study
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is a conditional statement ('If...then...'), which is modeled using the IMPLICATION operator. The 'if' condition is an OR of two specific drug therapies. The 'then' requirement is an AND of two conditions: a minimum duration of use and a plan to continue without change, where 'without change' is explicitly modeled using the NOT operator.

operands.atomicText: Using topical ophthalmic cyclosporine (e.g., RESTASIS®)
operands.strategy: Identifies patients on a specific topical ophthalmic immunomodulator.

operands.atomicText: Using lifitegrast 5% ophthalmic solution (e.g., Xiidra®)
operands.strategy: Identifies patients on a specific topical ophthalmic immunomodulator.

operands.atomicText: Using the qualifying ophthalmic drops for at least 90 days prior to the Screening Visit
operands.timeConstraint: Duration of use >= 90 days, occurring prior to the Screening Visit
operands.strategy: Ensures stable, long-term use of the qualifying medication before study entry.

operands.atomicText: Plan to change use of topical ophthalmic immunomodulators for the duration of the study
operands.strategy: Confirms patient intent to maintain a stable therapeutic regimen during the study. This is determined via patient interview.

provenance.textSnippet:
(if necessary) at Screening Visit
•
If using any form of topical ophthalmic cyclosporine (i.e., RESTASIS®),
lifitegrast 5% ophthalmic solution (Xiidra®), participants must be using the
drops for ≥ 90 days prior to the Screening Visit and plan to continue without
change for the duration of the study

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Intraocular pressure (IOP) ≤ 21 mmHg in both eyes at Screening Visit for patients with primary open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension (OHT). Patients with primary open-angle glaucoma or OHT were included provided they were on stable monotherapy bilaterally with IOP controlled (≤ 21 mmHg) in both eyes. Any topical IOP-lowering medications must have had a start date of ≥ 3 months prior to Screening Visit date and dosage that was not expected to change during the study.
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion defines a single cohort of patients with specific characteristics, so it is decomposed as a series of AND conditions. The core requirements are: a diagnosis of glaucoma or OHT, controlled intraocular pressure, and being on a specific type of stable monotherapy. The definition of 'stable' is further broken down into sub-conditions related to treatment duration and dosage.

operands.atomicText: Primary open-angle glaucoma
operands.strategy: Identifies patients with the primary disease indication.

operands.atomicText: Ocular hypertension (OHT)
operands.strategy: Identifies patients with the alternative disease indication.

operands.atomicText: Intraocular pressure (IOP) ≤ 21 mmHg in both eyes at Screening Visit
operands.strategy: Confirms IOP is controlled at baseline. 'Both eyes' implies two measurements meeting the criteria.

operands.atomicText: Receiving bilateral monotherapy with a topical IOP-lowering medication
operands.strategy: Patient must be on a single IOP-lowering medication in both eyes, and not multiple.

operand.atomicText: Start date of topical IOP-lowering medication
operand.strategy: Ensures the patient's therapy has been stable for a minimum duration before the study.

operands.atomicText: Dosage of topical IOP-lowering medication is not expected to change during the study
operands.strategy: Confirms the stability of the current treatment regimen, which is a prospective assessment.

provenance.textSnippet:
change for the duration of the study
•
Intraocular pressure (IOP) ≤ 21 mmHg in both eyes at Screening Visit for
patients with primary open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension (OHT).
Patients with primary open-angle glaucoma or OHT were included provided

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Was able to follow study instructions and was likely to complete all required visits
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion consists of two independent conditions joined by 'and', indicating a root AND operator. Both conditions are subjective assessments of the patient's ability to comply with the study protocol, making them atomic nodes that require manual review.

operands.atomicText: Able to follow study instructions
operands.strategy: This is a subjective assessment by the investigator to ensure the patient can understand and adhere to the study protocol.

operands.atomicText: Likely to complete all required study visits
operands.strategy: This is a subjective assessment by the investigator regarding the patient's reliability and commitment to completing the entire study.

provenance.textSnippet:
of ≥ 3 months prior to Screening Visit date and dosage that was not expected
to change during the study.
• Was able to follow study instructions and was likely to complete all required
visits

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Have uncontrolled severe systemic disease that, in the assessment of the investigator, would put safety of the participant at risk through participation, or which would prevent or confound protocol-specified assessments (e.g., hypertension and diabetes, Sjögren's syndrome, rheumatoid arthritis, systemic lupus erythematosus, immunodeficiency disease, etc.)
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion describes a single, complex reason for exclusion, which is decomposed into a primary logical AND structure. A patient is excluded if they have an 'uncontrolled severe systemic disease' AND that disease results in one of several negative outcomes. These outcomes (posing a safety risk, preventing assessments, or confounding assessments) are linked by an OR operator. The entire condition relies on the investigator's judgment, so all atomic nodes are marked as `requires_manual`. The specific diseases listed are treated as examples that inform the primary condition, not as separate, independent logical clauses.

operands.atomicText: Presence of an uncontrolled severe systemic disease
operands.strategy: This is a high-level assessment by the investigator that a patient's systemic disease is both severe and not adequately managed. Examples of such diseases mentioned in the protocol include hypertension, diabetes, Sjögren's syndrome, rheumatoid arthritis, systemic lupus erythematosus, and immunodeficiency disease.

operands.atomicText: Systemic disease would put the safety of the participant at risk through participation
operands.strategy: This is the investigator's clinical judgment that the patient's participation in the trial would pose an unacceptable safety risk due to their underlying systemic disease.

operands.atomicText: Systemic disease would prevent protocol-specified assessments
operands.strategy: This is the investigator's assessment that the patient's disease or its symptoms would make it impossible to perform required study procedures or assessments.

operands.atomicText: Systemic disease would confound protocol-specified assessments
operands.strategy: This is the investigator's assessment that the patient's disease or its symptoms would interfere with the interpretation of study data, compromising the scientific integrity of the assessments.

provenance.textSnippet:
6.2.2
Exclusion Criteria
Patients that have any of the following criteria will be excluded:
• Have uncontrolled severe systemic disease that, in the assessment of the
investigator, would put safety of the participant at risk through participation, or
which would prevent or confound protocol-specified assessments
(e.g., hypertension and diabetes, Sjögren's syndrome, rheumatoid arthritis,
systemic lupus erythematosus, immunodeficiency disease, etc.)

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Known allergy or sensitivity to the study products or their components
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is decomposed into an OR condition with two clauses. The first clause covers allergy or sensitivity to the study products themselves, and the second covers allergy or sensitivity to their components. A patient is ineligible if either of these conditions is met.

operands.atomicText: Known allergy or sensitivity to the study products
operands.strategy: This is a standard safety exclusion to prevent adverse reactions in patients with known hypersensitivity to the investigational drug(s). This requires mapping protocol-specific study products to clinical concepts.

operands.atomicText: Known allergy or sensitivity to the components of the study products
operands.strategy: This extends the safety exclusion to include excipients or other non-active ingredients in the study product formulation, which can also cause allergic reactions. This is difficult to query as it requires knowledge of the full drug formulation.

provenance.textSnippet:
systemic lupus erythematosus, immunodeficiency disease, etc.)
• Known allergy or sensitivity to the study products or their components

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Females who were pregnant, nursing, or planning a pregnancy
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion describes a population of females who meet one or more of three related conditions. This is modeled as a primary AND condition for being female, combined with a nested OR group for the three states: pregnant, nursing, or planning a pregnancy.

operands.atomicText: Female
operands.strategy: Filter for patients who are female.

operands.atomicText: Pregnant
operands.strategy: Identifies patients with a condition or observation of pregnancy.

operands.atomicText: Nursing
operands.strategy: Identifies patients who are currently nursing/lactating. This may require manual confirmation.

operands.atomicText: Planning a pregnancy
operands.strategy: Identifies patients who report planning a pregnancy. This typically requires manual confirmation.

provenance.textSnippet:
• Known allergy or sensitivity to the study products or their components
• Females who were pregnant, nursing, or planning a pregnancy

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Females of childbearing potential and who were not using a reliable method of contraception
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is a conjunction of two conditions joined by 'AND'. The first condition identifies females of childbearing potential. The second is a negative condition ('not using'), which is captured using a NOT operator wrapping the positive atomic condition 'using a reliable method of contraception'.

operands.atomicText: Female of childbearing potential
operands.strategy: Identifies the specific demographic subgroup of women who are biologically capable of becoming pregnant. This status is typically a clinical assessment.

operands.atomicText: Using a reliable method of contraception
operands.strategy: Checks for the use of effective birth control methods as specified by the protocol. The absence of this condition is required.

provenance.textSnippet:
• Females who were pregnant, nursing, or planning a pregnancy
• Females of childbearing potential and who were not using a reliable method of
contraception

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Current enrollment in an investigational drug or device study or participation in such a study within 30 days of entry into this study at Screening Visit
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion consists of two conditions linked by an 'OR' operator. The first condition is a current state ('Current enrollment'), and the second is a past state with a specific time window ('participation... within 30 days'). This structure is represented by a root OR node with two operands.

operands.atomicText: Current enrollment in an investigational drug or device study
operands.strategy: Identifies concurrent participation in another clinical trial at the time of screening.

operand.atomicText: Participation in an investigational drug or device study
operand.strategy: Identifies recent participation in another clinical trial to avoid carry-over effects from other investigational agents.

provenance.textSnippet:
contraception
•
Current enrollment in an investigational drug or device study or participation
in such a study within 30 days of entry into this study at Screening Visit

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Schirmer Test (with anesthesia) ≤ 2 mm in either eye at Screening Visit
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is decomposed using an OR operator to capture the 'in either eye' logic. This creates two parallel branches, one for each eye, where meeting the Schirmer Test threshold in at least one eye satisfies the condition.

operands.atomicText: Schirmer Test (with anesthesia) result in one eye is ≤ 2 mm at Screening Visit
operands.strategy: Confirms severe aqueous tear deficiency in the left eye as part of diagnostic confirmation for a condition like dry eye disease.

operands.atomicText: Schirmer Test (with anesthesia) result in the other eye is ≤ 2 mm at Screening Visit
operands.strategy: Confirms severe aqueous tear deficiency in the right eye as part of diagnostic confirmation for a condition like dry eye disease.

provenance.textSnippet:
in such a study within 30 days of entry into this study at Screening Visit
• Schirmer Test (with anesthesia) ≤ 2 mm in either eye at Screening Visit

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Patient anticipated contact lens wear during the study, or the patient had worn contact lenses in the last 3 months prior to Screening Visit
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is a simple OR condition, combining two scenarios related to contact lens wear. The first is a future-looking intent, and the second is a retrospective look at recent use. The tree structure is an OR operator with two child nodes representing each condition.

operands.atomicText: Anticipated contact lens wear during the study
operands.strategy: This is a forward-looking condition based on patient interview to prevent interference with study procedures or assessments.

operand.timeConstraint: in the last 3 months prior to Screening Visit
operand.strategy: This captures recent contact lens use prior to the study, which might affect baseline measurements.

provenance.textSnippet:
• Schirmer Test (with anesthesia) ≤ 2 mm in either eye at Screening Visit
•
Patient anticipated contact lens wear during the study, or the patient had worn
contact lenses in the last 3 months prior to Screening Visit

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Any scheduled or planned elective ocular or systemic surgery or procedure during the study, which in the investigator's opinion, may have impacted the patient's study participation
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion describes an exclusion based on a future event. It is structured as an 'A which B' pattern, which translates to 'A AND B'. 'A' is the description of the event (a planned surgery/procedure during the study), and 'B' is the investigator's assessment of its impact. The event description 'A' contains an OR condition ('ocular or systemic'), which is represented as an OR node with two atomic operands.

operands.atomicText: Scheduled or planned elective ocular surgery or procedure
operands.strategy: Identifies any planned, non-emergency eye-related surgeries or procedures that would occur during the trial period.

operands.atomicText: Scheduled or planned elective systemic surgery or procedure
operands.strategy: Identifies any planned, non-emergency major body system surgeries or procedures that would occur during the trial period.

operands.atomicText: Investigator's opinion: surgery or procedure may impact study participation
operands.strategy: Captures the required clinical judgment that a planned procedure would interfere with the patient's ability to participate in the study, making them ineligible.

provenance.textSnippet:
contact lenses in the last 3 months prior to Screening Visit
• Any scheduled or planned elective ocular or systemic surgery or procedure
during the study, which in the investigator's opinion, may have impacted the
patient's study participation

decomposedCriteria.originalText: At the Screening and Baseline visits, either eye has corneal staining score of 5 in any of the 5 zones or a total score of > 19 based on the modified NEI grading scheme (score range = 0 to 5; graded in 5 zones of the cornea for a total score range of 0 to 25) or conjunctival staining score of 5 in any of the 6 zones based on the modified NEI grading scheme (score range = 0 to 5 per zone)
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion consists of three conditions linked by 'or', forming a single disjunctive clause. This is represented by a root OR operator with three atomic operands, each describing a specific ocular staining score threshold (focal corneal, total corneal, or focal conjunctival) that must be met in either eye at the screening or baseline visits.

operands.atomicText: Corneal staining score of 5 in any of the 5 zones in either eye

numericConstraintStructured.parameter: Maximum corneal staining score in any zone (modified NEI grading)

operands.strategy: This atomic identifies patients with severe focal corneal staining in at least one zone of either eye, which is a key indicator of severe dry eye disease.

operands.atomicText: Total corneal staining score > 19 in either eye

numericConstraintStructured.parameter: Total corneal staining score (modified NEI grading)

operands.strategy: This atomic identifies patients with severe diffuse corneal staining across all zones of either eye, another indicator of severe dry eye disease.

operands.atomicText: Conjunctival staining score of 5 in any of the 6 zones in either eye

numericConstraintStructured.parameter: Maximum conjunctival staining score in any zone (modified NEI grading)

operands.strategy: This atomic identifies patients with severe focal conjunctival staining, a sign of significant ocular surface disease.

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Use of systemic medications (over-the-counter, herbal, prescription, or nutritional supplements for dry eyes), which may have affected tear film or vision (including but not limited to the following: flax seed oil, fish oil, omega-3 supplements, cyclosporine, antihistamines, cholinergic agents, anticholinergics, antimuscarines, beta-blocking agents, tricyclic antidepressants, phenothiazines, estrogen-progesterone, and other estrogen derivatives), unless that medication had been used at the same dose for at least 3 months prior to screening and the dosage was not expected to change during the course of the study
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is a conditional exclusion, modeled with an IMPLICATION operator. The 'IF' condition (the use of specific medications) is represented by an OR group of all listed drug classes. The 'THEN' requirement for eligibility (the 'unless' clause) is an AND of two stability conditions: a stable dose for 3+ months and no expected dosage change.

operands.atomicText: Use of systemic medications which may affect tear film or vision
operands.strategy: This is a general catch-all for any systemic medication that could interfere with the study's primary endpoints related to tear film or vision, requiring clinical review.

operands.atomicText: Use of flax seed oil
operands.strategy: Query for drug exposures to flax seed oil.

operands.atomicText: Use of fish oil
operands.strategy: Query for drug exposures to fish oil.

operands.atomicText: Use of omega-3 supplements
operands.strategy: Query for drug exposures to omega-3 supplements.

operands.atomicText: Use of cyclosporine
operands.strategy: Query for drug exposures to cyclosporine.

operands.atomicText: Use of antihistamines
operands.strategy: Query for drug exposures to the antihistamine class.

operands.atomicText: Use of cholinergic agents
operands.strategy: Query for drug exposures to the cholinergic agent class.

operands.atomicText: Use of anticholinergics
operands.strategy: Query for drug exposures to the anticholinergic class.

operands.atomicText: Use of antimuscarinics
operands.strategy: Query for drug exposures to the antimuscarinic class.

operands.atomicText: Use of beta-blocking agents
operands.strategy: Query for drug exposures to the beta-blocker class.

operands.atomicText: Use of tricyclic antidepressants
operands.strategy: Query for drug exposures to the tricyclic antidepressant class.

operands.atomicText: Use of phenothiazines
operands.strategy: Query for drug exposures to the phenothiazine class.

operands.atomicText: Use of estrogen-progesterone
operands.strategy: Query for drug exposures to combination estrogen-progesterone therapies.

operands.atomicText: Use of other estrogen derivatives
operands.strategy: Query for drug exposures to other estrogen derivatives.

operands.atomicText: Medication used at a stable dose for at least 3 months prior to screening
operands.timeConstraint: for at least 3 months prior to screening
operands.strategy: Requires manual review of medication history to confirm the dose has been stable for the specified duration leading up to the screening visit.

operands.atomicText: Medication dosage was expected to change during the course of the study
operands.strategy: Requires confirmation at screening that there is no plan to alter the dosage of the specified medication during the study period.

decomposedCriteria.originalText:
Presence of 1 or more of the following ocular conditions in at least 1 eye:

○ Active ocular infection or non-keratoconjunctivitis sicca (KCS) ocular inflammation

Ο Active ocular allergy
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion requires one or more of several ocular conditions, which translates to a top-level OR operator. The condition 'non-keratoconjunctivitis sicca (KCS) ocular inflammation' is decomposed into a nested AND operator, requiring the presence of 'ocular inflammation' and the explicit absence (using a NOT operator) of 'keratoconjunctivitis sicca'.

operands.atomicText: Active ocular infection in at least 1 eye
operands.strategy: Identifies patients with an active eye infection.

operands.atomicText: Active ocular inflammation in at least 1 eye
operands.strategy: Identifies patients with active eye inflammation.

operands.atomicText: Keratoconjunctivitis sicca (KCS) in at least 1 eye
operands.strategy: Excludes patients whose inflammation is specifically KCS (dry eye syndrome).

operands.atomicText: Active ocular allergy in at least 1 eye
operands.strategy: Identifies patients with an active eye allergy.

provenance.textSnippet:
the course of the study
• Presence of 1 or more of the following ocular conditions in at least 1 eye:
○ Active ocular infection or non-keratoconjunctivitis sicca (KCS) ocular
inflammation
Ο Active ocular allergy

decomposedCriteria.originalText: History of recurrent herpes keratitis or active disease within 6 months prior to Screening Visit
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is decomposed using an OR operator to connect two conditions. The first condition is a lifelong history of recurrent herpes keratitis, represented as a single atomic node. The second condition is active herpes keratitis within a specific timeframe, which is represented by an atomic node wrapped in a temporal node.

operands.atomicText: History of recurrent herpes keratitis
operands.strategy: Identifies any patient with a diagnosis code for recurrent herpes keratitis at any time in their history.

operand.timeConstraint: within 6 months prior to Screening Visit
operand.strategy: Identifies patients with a recent, active episode of herpes keratitis. The 'active' status may require additional clinical context or specific codes indicating an acute event.

provenance.textSnippet:
inflammation
Ο Active ocular allergy
History of recurrent herpes keratitis or active disease within 6 months prior to
Screening Visit

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Corneal disorder or abnormality that affected corneal sensitivity or normal spreading of the tear film (except superficial punctate keratitis)
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is structured as a main condition with a specific exclusion. This is modeled using an EXCEPT operator. The main condition itself is complex, requiring both a diagnosis ('Corneal disorder or abnormality') and a resulting functional impact ('affected corneal sensitivity or normal spreading of the tear film'), which translates to an AND operator with a nested OR.

operands.atomicText: Corneal disorder or abnormality
operands.strategy: Identifies any diagnosed disorder or structural abnormality of the cornea.

operands.atomicText: Corneal sensitivity affected
operands.strategy: Identifies findings related to abnormal or reduced corneal sensitivity, which may require manual chart review to confirm.

operands.atomicText: Normal spreading of the tear film affected
operands.strategy: Identifies conditions like dry eye syndrome or abnormal tear film break-up time, which may require manual chart review to confirm.

operands.atomicText: Superficial punctate keratitis
operands.strategy: This is a specific, often transient, condition that is explicitly exempted from the main exclusion criterion.

provenance.textSnippet:
Screening Visit
• Corneal disorder or abnormality that affected corneal sensitivity or normal
spreading of the tear film (except superficial punctate keratitis)

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Severe blepharitis or obvious inflammation of the lid margin, which in the judgment of the investigator, may have interfered with the interpretation of the study results
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is decomposed into a primary AND structure. The first operand is an OR group containing the two clinical conditions ('Severe blepharitis' or 'obvious inflammation of the lid margin'). The second operand is the qualifying clause that these conditions must be judged by the investigator to potentially interfere with study results.

operands.atomicText: Severe blepharitis
operands.strategy: Identify a diagnosis of blepharitis. The 'severe' modifier requires clinical assessment.

operands.atomicText: Obvious inflammation of the lid margin
operands.strategy: Identify a diagnosis or clinical finding of inflammation of the eyelid margin. The 'obvious' modifier requires clinical assessment.

operands.atomicText: Condition may have interfered with the interpretation of the study results in the judgment of the investigator
operands.strategy: This is a subjective assessment made by the clinical investigator at the time of screening and cannot be queried from standard EHR data.

provenance.textSnippet:
spreading of the tear film (except superficial punctate keratitis)
• Severe blepharitis or obvious inflammation of the lid margin, which in the
judgment of the investigator, may have interfered with the interpretation of the
study results

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Keratoconjunctivitis sicca secondary to the destruction of conjunctival goblet cells, such as occurs with vitamin A deficiency or scarring such as that with cicatricial pemphigoid, alkali burns, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, trachoma, or irradiation
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion defines a specific type of Keratoconjunctivitis sicca (KCS) by its underlying cause. This is decomposed as a primary AND condition: the patient must have KCS, AND the KCS must be caused by one of several specified conditions, which are handled by a nested OR list.

operands.atomicText: Keratoconjunctivitis sicca
operands.strategy: Identifies patients with the primary diagnosis of interest.

operands.atomicText: Vitamin A deficiency
operands.strategy: Identifies an underlying cause of KCS involving destruction of conjunctival goblet cells.

operands.atomicText: Cicatricial pemphigoid
operands.strategy: Identifies an underlying scarring cause of KCS involving destruction of conjunctival goblet cells.

operands.atomicText: Alkali burn of the eye
operands.strategy: Identifies an underlying scarring cause of KCS involving destruction of conjunctival goblet cells.

operands.atomicText: Stevens-Johnson syndrome
operands.strategy: Identifies an underlying scarring cause of KCS involving destruction of conjunctival goblet cells.

operands.atomicText: Trachoma
operands.strategy: Identifies an underlying scarring cause of KCS involving destruction of conjunctival goblet cells.

operands.atomicText: History of therapeutic irradiation to head or neck
operands.strategy: Identifies an underlying cause of KCS involving destruction of conjunctival goblet cells.

provenance.textSnippet:
study results
• Keratoconjunctivitis sicca secondary to the destruction of conjunctival goblet
cells, such as occurs with vitamin A deficiency or scarring such as that with
cicatricial pemphigoid, alkali burns, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, trachoma, or
irradiation

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Substantial non-KCS keratitis with overlying corneal stain or other significant corneal findings not directly related to dry eye; in addition, patients with dry eye signs/symptoms (e.g., filamentary keratitis) of a severity where topical monotherapy with an artificial tear would have been inappropriate
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion describes two distinct patient populations separated by a semicolon. The phrase 'in addition' can be ambiguous, but interpreting it as AND would create a contradictory requirement for a patient to have both a non-dry-eye and a dry-eye condition. Therefore, a top-level OR operator is used to represent two eligible groups: (1) patients with specific non-dry-eye corneal findings, or (2) patients with severe dry eye symptoms.

operands.atomicText: Substantial non-KCS keratitis
operands.strategy: Identifies patients with significant inflammation of the cornea not caused by dry eye (Keratoconjunctivitis Sicca). The 'substantial' modifier requires clinical assessment.

operands.atomicText: Overlying corneal stain
operands.strategy: Confirms epithelial damage associated with the keratitis, typically assessed via fluorescein staining.

operands.atomicText: Other significant corneal findings
operands.strategy: A catch-all for other clinically important corneal issues that are not specified. Requires manual review.

operands.atomicText: Corneal findings are directly related to dry eye
operands.strategy: Excludes findings that are a manifestation of dry eye disease from this specific sub-clause.

operands.atomicText: Dry eye signs or symptoms present
operands.strategy: Identifies the general population with dry eye disease based on clinical signs or patient-reported symptoms.

operands.atomicText: Filamentary keratitis
operands.strategy: Identifies a specific, severe sign of dry eye disease that has a corresponding diagnosis code.

operands.atomicText: Severity of dry eye signs/symptoms is appropriate for topical monotherapy with an artificial tear
operands.strategy: This clause selects for patients with severe dry eye, defined as being beyond the point where simple artificial tears alone would be considered adequate treatment. This is a clinical judgment.

provenance.textSnippet:
irradiation
•
Substantial non-KCS keratitis with overlying corneal stain or other significant
corneal findings not directly related to dry eye; in addition, patients with dry
eye signs/symptoms (e.g., filamentary keratitis) of a severity where topical
monotherapy with an artificial tear would have been inappropriate

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Occlusion of the lacrimal puncta for either eye, with punctal plugs or cauterization < 3 months prior to Screening Visit
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion describes a single event (occlusion) that must occur within a specific time frame. The event can be caused by one of two procedures (punctal plugs OR cauterization). This is modeled as a temporal node wrapping an OR operator, which in turn contains two atomic nodes for the respective procedures.

operands.atomicText: Occlusion of the lacrimal puncta with punctal plugs
operands.strategy: Identifies patients who have had a procedure to block the tear duct with a plug.

operands.atomicText: Occlusion of the lacrimal puncta with cauterization
operands.strategy: Identifies patients who have had a procedure to block the tear duct with cauterization.

provenance.textSnippet:
monotherapy with an artificial tear would have been inappropriate
• Occlusion of the lacrimal puncta for either eye, with punctal plugs or
cauterization < 3 months prior to Screening Visit

decomposedCriteria.originalText: History of prior ocular/ophthalmic surgery or trauma, which could affect corneal sensitivity and/or tear distribution (e.g., cataract surgery, laser-assisted in situ keratomileusis [LASIK], photorefractive keratectomy, or any surgery involving a limbal or corneal incision) within 6 months prior to at Screening Visit
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion describes a set of ocular/ophthalmic surgeries or traumas that are exclusionary if they occurred within a specific timeframe. The logic is an OR condition for the various events, all wrapped within a single temporal constraint of 'within 6 months prior to Screening Visit'.

operands.atomicText: History of ocular/ophthalmic trauma
operands.strategy: Identifies patients with a history of eye trauma, which could affect study endpoints like corneal sensitivity or tear distribution.

operands.atomicText: Cataract surgery
operands.strategy: Identifies patients with a history of cataract surgery, an example of a procedure that could affect study endpoints.

operands.atomicText: Laser-assisted in situ keratomileusis (LASIK)
operands.strategy: Identifies patients with a history of LASIK, an example of a procedure that could affect study endpoints.

operands.atomicText: Photorefractive keratectomy
operands.strategy: Identifies patients with a history of photorefractive keratectomy, an example of a procedure that could affect study endpoints.

operands.atomicText: Any surgery involving a limbal or corneal incision
operands.strategy: A broader category to capture other relevant ocular surgeries not explicitly listed that involve incisions that could affect study endpoints.

provenance.textSnippet:
• History of prior ocular/ophthalmic surgery or trauma, which could affect
corneal sensitivity and/or tear distribution (e.g., cataract surgery, laser-assisted
in situ keratomileusis [LASIK], photorefractive keratectomy, or any surgery
involving a limbal or corneal incision) within 6 months prior to at Screening
Visit

decomposedCriteria.originalText:
Patients who were currently using topical ocular medication or had used topical ocular medication within 2 weeks of Screening Visit; however, patients who were being treated bilaterally with the following could have been considered:

Ο Current use of a marketed artificial tear, which was to have been discontinued at the Screening Visit

○ Monotherapy for glaucoma or OHT using a prostaglandin analog, beta-blocker, alpha-2 agonist, or carbonic anhydrase inhibitors; any topical IOP-lowering medications must have had a start date of ≥ 3 months prior to Screening Visit and the dosage was not expected to change during the study

Ο If using any form of topical ophthalmic cyclosporine (i.e., RESTASIS®), lifitegrast 5% ophthalmic solution (Xiidra®), for less than 90 days prior to Screening Visit
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is structured as an exclusion with exceptions. This is best represented by an EXCEPT operator, where the first operand defines the broad excluded group (recent topical ocular medication users) and the second operand defines the specific medication scenarios that are permitted.

operands.atomicText: Currently using topical ocular medication
operands.strategy: Identifies patients with ongoing use of any topical ocular medication at the time of screening.

operand.strategy: Identifies patients with recent use of any topical ocular medication leading up to screening.

operands.atomicText: Current bilateral use of a marketed artificial tear, to be discontinued at the Screening Visit
operands.strategy: Allows patients using artificial tears, with the procedural requirement that they are stopped.

operands.atomicText: Bilateral monotherapy for glaucoma or OHT
operands.strategy: Identifies patients on a single, stable therapy for glaucoma or OHT.

operands.atomicText: Use of a prostaglandin analog
operands.strategy: Specifies an allowed class of glaucoma medication.

operands.atomicText: Use of a beta-blocker
operands.strategy: Specifies an allowed class of glaucoma medication.

operands.atomicText: Use of an alpha-2 agonist
operands.strategy: Specifies an allowed class of glaucoma medication.

operands.atomicText: Use of a carbonic anhydrase inhibitor
operands.strategy: Specifies an allowed class of glaucoma medication.

operands.atomicText: Start date of topical IOP-lowering medication is >= 3 months prior to Screening Visit
operands.timeConstraint: start date >= 3 months prior to Screening Visit
operands.strategy: Ensures the allowed glaucoma therapy is stable and long-term.

operands.atomicText: Dosage of topical IOP-lowering medication is expected to change during the study
operands.strategy: Ensures stability of the allowed glaucoma therapy throughout the study.

operands.atomicText: Use of any form of topical ophthalmic cyclosporine (e.g., RESTASIS®)
operands.strategy: Identifies use of a specific allowed immunomodulatory agent.

operands.atomicText: Use of lifitegrast 5% ophthalmic solution (Xiidra®)
operands.strategy: Identifies use of a specific allowed immunomodulatory agent.

operands.atomicText: Duration of use is less than 90 days prior to Screening Visit
operands.timeConstraint: duration of therapy < 90 days prior to Screening Visit
operands.strategy: Restricts the exception to patients who have been on the therapy for a relatively short duration.

• Monotherapy for glaucoma or OHT using a prostaglandin analog, beta-

IOP-loweri...

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Patients who were currently being treated with both IOP-lowering medication and any form of topical ophthalmic cyclosporine (i.e., RESTASIS®) or lifitegrast 5% ophthalmic solution (Xiidra®) or generic of these medications cannot be enrolled
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is an exclusion, indicated by 'cannot be enrolled'. This is modeled with a root NOT operator. The condition for exclusion is the concurrent use of two types of medications ('both...and...'), which is represented by an AND operator. The second medication type is a list of alternatives ('...or...'), which is captured by a nested OR operator.

operands.atomicText: Currently being treated with IOP-lowering medication
operands.strategy: Identify patients on any medication intended to lower intraocular pressure.

operands.atomicText: Currently being treated with any form of topical ophthalmic cyclosporine (including RESTASIS® and generics)
operands.strategy: Identify use of cyclosporine ophthalmic solutions, covering both brand and generic formulations.

operands.atomicText: Currently being treated with lifitegrast 5% ophthalmic solution (including Xiidra® and generics)
operands.strategy: Identify use of lifitegrast ophthalmic solutions, covering both brand and generic formulations.

provenance.textSnippet:
Screening Visit
• Patients who were currently being treated with both IOP-lowering medication
and any form of topical ophthalmic cyclosporine (i.e., RESTASIS®) or
lifitegrast 5% ophthalmic solution (Xiidra®) or generic of these medications
cannot be enrolled

decomposedCriteria.originalText: Patient had a condition or is in a situation, which in the investigator's opinion, may have put the patient at significant risk, may have confounded the study results, or may have interfered significantly with the patient's participation in the study
decomposedCriteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is a disjunction (OR) of three distinct reasons for exclusion, all of which are based on the investigator's subjective opinion. Each reason is treated as a separate atomic condition, resulting in an OR operator with three child nodes. These conditions are not queryable from structured data.

operands.atomicText: Investigator opinion: patient has a condition or situation that may put them at significant risk
operands.strategy: This is a general safety exclusion based on the investigator's clinical judgment to protect the patient's well-being.

operands.atomicText: Investigator opinion: patient has a condition or situation that may confound the study results
operands.strategy: This clause ensures data integrity by excluding patients whose underlying conditions could interfere with the interpretation of the study's findings.

operands.atomicText: Investigator opinion: patient has a condition or situation that may interfere significantly with study participation
operands.strategy: This clause ensures protocol compliance and feasibility by excluding patients who may not be able to complete all study procedures.

provenance.textSnippet:
lifitegrast 5% ophthalmic solution (Xiidra®) or generic of these medications
cannot be enrolled
•
Patient had a condition or is in a situation, which in the investigator's opinion,
may have put the patient at significant risk, may have confounded the study
results, or may have interfered significantly with the patient's participation in
the study
